title: Directs establishment and administration of a statewide program for telephone access for all New Yorkers, including the hearing and visually impaired
summary: Directs the department of public service to implement a program assuring access to telephone service for all New Yorkers, including but not limited to the hearing and visually impaired; provides for the use of assistive telecommunications devices or adaptive equipment; directs local service companies to bear their proportionate share of the costs.

       AN  ACT to amend the public service law, in relation to telephone access
         for all New Yorkers

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The public service law is amended by adding a new section
    2  91-b to read as follows:
    3    S 91-B. TELEPHONE ACCESS FOR ALL NEW YORKERS. 1. THE COMMISSION  SHALL
    4  ESTABLISH  AND  ADMINISTER A STATEWIDE PROGRAM TO DISTRIBUTE, AT NO COST
    5  TO THE RECIPIENTS, ASSISTIVE TELECOMMUNICATIONS DEVICES TO  PERSONS  WHO
    6  ARE  DEAF,  HARD OF HEARING, SEVERELY SPEECH IMPAIRED, OR DEAF-BLIND, OR
    7  ADAPTIVE EQUIPMENT TO PERMIT THE USE OF TELECOMMUNICATIONS EQUIPMENT  TO
    8  PERSONS WITH OTHER PHYSICAL DISABILITIES SO THAT TELEPHONE SERVICE SHALL
    9  BE MADE GENERALLY AVAILABLE TO ALL DISABLED PERSONS IN THE STATE.
   10    2.  IN  ORDER  TO  BE  ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE ASSISTIVE TELECOMMUNICATION
   11  DEVICES OR ADAPTIVE EQUIPMENT, INDIVIDUALS MUST BE AT LEAST  FIVE  YEARS
   12  OLD  AND  MUST  BE  CERTIFIED AS HAVING THE DISABILITY THAT REQUIRES THE
   13  PARTICULAR ASSISTIVE TELECOMMUNICATION  DEVICES  OR  ADAPTIVE  EQUIPMENT
   14  REQUESTED  BY  THE  INDIVIDUAL  BY  A PERSON OR AGENCY AUTHORIZED BY THE
   15  COMMISSION TO MAKE SUCH CERTIFICATIONS. SUCH PERSONS SHALL  INCLUDE  BUT
   16  NEED NOT BE LIMITED TO PHYSICIANS, AUDIOLOGISTS, SPEECH-LANGUAGE PATHOL-
   17  OGISTS, VOCATIONAL REHABILITATION COUNSELORS, OR OTHER QUALIFIED PROFES-
   18  SIONALS WITHIN THE AREA OF THEIR QUALIFICATIONS.
   19    3.  NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OTHER PROVISION OF THIS SECTION, AN INDIVIDUAL
   20  WHO IS HEARING IMPAIRED TO A DEGREE THAT THE ONLY ASSISTIVE TELECOMMUNI-
   21  CATION DEVICES REQUIRED FOR EFFECTIVE TELEPHONE COMMUNICATIONS WOULD  BE
   22  AN  AMPLIFIER,  AMPLIFIED TELEPHONE, AN AUDIBLE SIGNALING DEVICE, OR ANY
   23  COMBINATION THEREOF THAT ARE READILY AVAILABLE ON THE RETAIL MARKET AT A

    1  PRICE SUCH THAT THE COST (AS DETERMINED BY THE COMMISSION) OF THE COMBI-
    2  NATION OF SUCH DEVICES DOES NOT EXCEED TWO HUNDRED PERCENT OF THE  AVER-
    3  AGE  COST  OF  A NON-AMPLIFIED TELEPHONE OF SIMILAR QUALITY SHALL NOT BE
    4  ENTITLED  TO RECEIVE SUCH ASSISTIVE TELECOMMUNICATION DEVICES UNLESS THE
    5  INDIVIDUAL IS A MEMBER OF A FAMILY WITH A FAMILY INCOME OF LESS THAN TWO
    6  HUNDRED PERCENT OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL.
    7    4. THE COMMISSION SHALL PROMULGATE SUCH REGULATIONS AS  ARE  NECESSARY
    8  TO IMPLEMENT THE PROGRAM ESTABLISHED BY THIS SECTION, INCLUDING, BUT NOT
    9  LIMITED TO, REGULATIONS CONCERNING TECHNOLOGY ELIGIBLE FOR DISTRIBUTION,
   10  METHODS  OF  ENCOURAGING AND TAKING ADVANTAGE OF TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES,
   11  AND METHODS OF ESTABLISHING PRIORITIES  AMONG  APPLICANTS,  WHICH  SHALL
   12  TAKE  INTO CONSIDERATION THE FACT THAT AN APPLICANT HAS ASSISTIVE EQUIP-
   13  MENT AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION REGARDLESS OF THE SOURCE OF FUNDING  FOR
   14  SUCH ASSISTIVE EQUIPMENT.
   15    5.  THE  DEPARTMENT SHALL UTILIZE THE ASSISTANCE OF AND COOPERATE WITH
   16  COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS FOR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN  THE  AREAS  OF
   17  TRAINING,  OUTREACH,  EQUIPMENT DISTRIBUTION, TROUBLESHOOTING, AND OTHER
   18  AREAS WHICH MAY BE APPROPRIATE FOR COMMUNITY BASED PROGRAMS.    COMMUNI-
   19  TY-BASED  PROGRAMS  SHALL  BE  COMPENSATED  FOR  THE SERVICES WHICH THEY
   20  PROVIDE.
   21    6. THE DEPARTMENT  SHALL  CONVENE  AND  SUPPORT  A  CITIZENS  ADVISORY
   22  COMMITTEE  ON TELEPHONE ACCESS FOR ALL NEW YORKERS. THE ADVISORY COMMIT-
   23  TEE SHALL CONSIST OF ONE MEMBER EACH  APPOINTED  BY  THE  GOVERNOR,  THE
   24  TEMPORARY  PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY, AND
   25  AT LEAST FOUR ADDITIONAL MEMBERS WHO REPRESENT PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES,
   26  INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, PEOPLE WHO ARE HARD OF HEARING, DEAF,  OR
   27  DEAF-BLIND.  THE  LATTER MEMBERS SHALL BE APPOINTED BY THE GOVERNOR UPON
   28  NOMINATION BY PROVIDERS OF COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES TO PEOPLE WITH DISA-
   29  BILITIES, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND OTHER INTERESTED PARTIES.
   30    7. THE DEPARTMENT, IN COOPERATION WITH THE ADVISORY  COMMITTEE,  SHALL
   31  PROVIDE A REPORT TO THE GOVERNOR, THE TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE,
   32  AND THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY ONE YEAR FROM THE EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS
   33  SECTION  AND ANNUALLY ON THAT DATE THEREAFTER. THE REPORT SHALL DOCUMENT
   34  THE PROGRESS OF THE PROGRAM IN PROVIDING TELEPHONE  ACCESS  TO  ALL  NEW
   35  YORKERS.
   36    S 2. Section 18-a of the public service law is amended by adding a new
   37  subdivision 3-a to read as follows:
   38    3-A.  THE  CHAIRPERSON  OF THE COMMISSION SHALL ESTIMATE, PRIOR TO THE
   39  START OF EACH FISCAL YEAR BEGINNING AFTER MARCH THIRTY-FIRST OF THE YEAR
   40  AFTER THE YEAR IN WHICH THIS SUBDIVISION WAS ADDED, THE TOTAL COSTS  AND
   41  EXPENSES  OF  OPERATING  THE PROGRAM TO PROVIDE EQUIPMENT TO ALLOW TELE-
   42  PHONE ACCESS TO ALL NEW YORKERS ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO SECTION  NINETY-
   43  ONE-B OF THIS CHAPTER FOR THE FOLLOWING FISCAL YEAR, INCLUDING THE COSTS
   44  OF  EQUIPMENT  AND OF ADMINISTERING THE PROGRAM. BASED ON SUCH ESTIMATE,
   45  THE CHAIRPERSON SHALL DETERMINE THE AMOUNT TO BE PAID AS A CONDITION  OF
   46  DOING BUSINESS WITHIN THIS STATE BY EACH TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMPANY THAT
   47  PROVIDES  LOCAL SERVICE IN THIS STATE; PROVIDED, HOWEVER, THAT THE TOTAL
   48  COSTS AND EXPENSES SHALL BE ALLOCATED TO  EACH  SUCH  TELECOMMUNICATIONS
   49  COMPANY  IN  THE  PROPORTION  THAT THE NUMBER OF TELEPHONE LINES IN THIS
   50  STATE OF EACH SUCH TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMPANY BEARS TO THE TOTAL  NUMBER
   51  OF  LINES  IN  THE  STATE, AND A BILL SHALL BE RENDERED THEREFOR TO EACH
   52  SUCH TELECOMMUNICATIONS COMPANY ACCORDINGLY.
   53    S 3. Subdivision 5 of section 18-a  of  the  public  service  law,  as
   54  amended  by  chapter  788  of  the  laws  of 1978, is amended to read as
   55  follows:

    1    5. On demand made within thirty days of  the  rendition  of  any  bill
    2  pursuant  to  subdivision  two, three, THREE-A, or four of this section,

   10  pursuant  to  the provisions of section fourteen-a of the banking law in
   11  effect on the day immediately [preceeding] PRECEDING the date  on  which
   12  the provisions of this subdivision, as amended, become effective, but if
   13  the  commission  has  not set such rate, interest at six [percentum] PER
   14  CENTUM per annum shall apply. Any interest rate set  by  the  commission
   15  shall  become  effective  not  less  than  sixty days after such rate is
   16  promulgated.
   17    S 4. This act shall take effect immediately.
